description: The International Court of Justice (ICJ) which today stayed the execution+ of former Indian Navy officer Kulbhushan Jadhav, is presided by Ronny Abraham, who has earlier served as a judge in the Court of Justice of the European Communities.
title: Kulbhushan Jadhav verdict: Meet the 'wise men' behind the ICJ - Times of India

author: Iain Marlow
description: The International Court of Justice has ordered Pakistan to halt the execution of a former Indian naval officer pending a final decision in the proceedings.
title: UN Court Orders Pakistan to Halt Execution of Indian Man

description: The International Court of Justice (ICJ) will on Thursday pronounce its verdict on the Kulbhushan Jadhav case, government sources confirmed here.
title: ICJ to pronounce verdict on Kulbhushan Jadhav today - Times of India

author: Indrani Bagchi
description: With the International Court of Justice staying Kulbhushan Jadhav’s execution, Pakistan will have to wait till the case is heard in detail and a verdict delivered.
title: Pak could ignore ICJ order on Jadhav; India may seek access afresh - Times of India

author: Internet Desk
description: In a few hours, the International Court of Justice is expected to deliver its order on India’s request for the indication of provisional measures, that could put a temporary halt on the execution of K
title: What to expect from the ICJ verdict on Kulbhushan Jadhav

description: NEW DELHI: The International Court of Justice (ICJ) today unanimously stayed Pakistan's execution of Indian national Kulbhushan Jadhav until it rules on the merits of the case.
title: Kulbhushan Jadhav case:  The four issues that swung ICJ's ruling India's way - Times of India

description: Pakistan on Monday while presenting its case at the International Court of Justice (ICJ) on Kulbhushan Jadhav issue claimed that "India has used this court as the scene of political theatre."
title: At ICJ, Pakistan says India's application on Kulbhushan Jadhav is unnecessary, misconceived - Times of India

description: The International Court of Justice (ICJ) will pronounce its verdict on the Kulbhushan Jadhav case on Thursday, three days after it heard arguments presented by India and Pakistan. According to government sources, the international court will give its verdict around 3.30 pm (IST) tomorrow.
title: Kulbhushan Jadhav case: ICJ to pronounce verdict tomorrow - Times of India

description: The International Court of Justice (ICJ) today unanimously stayed Pakistan's execution of Indian national Kulbhushan Jadhav until it rules on the merits of the case. The ICJ ruled that there is the possibility of "irrevocable prejudice to the rights of Jadhav.
title: Pakistan cannot execute Kulbhushan Jadhav till the court rules on case: ICJ - Times of India

author: Vidya Ram
description: International Court of Justice will decide whether to order Pakistan to temporarily halt the execution of the former Indian naval officer after what India termed a “farcical” military trial.
title: ICJ verdict on Kulbhushan Jadhav at 3.30 p.m. today
